column4: hey guys my e-gnome is broken.. ( can i fix it in some easy way? reinstalling?
Mine works
What did you do?

Try running it manually. The way to do this is to go to a console, stop gdm (sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop) then start an X server with "X -ac :0" then, in another console, do "export DISPLAY=localhost:0" then "export WINDOW_MANAGER=enlightenment" then "gnome-session". That should work
This is just the /usr/bin/starte16 script, yes?
tell you what, try logging into regualr GNOME, go into preferences>session and make metacity a regular process (not restart) then stop it and run enlightenment from a terminal, see if that works
OK, so it is probably the script. Try "cat /usr/bin/starte16"
It should basically do (for GNOME) WINDOW_MANAGER=enlightenment then gnome-session. That is all it should need to do
Yes, so it is OK. Hmm, why isn;t it logging in? This is puzzling
If you try the method I said before about using consoles then you are manually doing what the script should be doing
Maybe try running an X then "starte16 GNOME"
(bear in mind that I am using a newer version of e16 than is in Ubuntu, but the Ubuntu version worked fine for me anyway)
Do "export DISPLAY-localhost:0" then either un "starte16 GNOME" or do "export WINDOW_MANAGER=enlightenment" "gnome-session" yourself
Uninstall e16, since Ubuntu's version just calls itself "enlightenment", so that may be conflicting
okay. so would i have to reinstall E17 after that?
I don't know
okay thanks.
There is an Ubuntu repository for E17 somewhere...
ill just comment away locateecho and hope it doesnt do anything...
Maybe you screwed your system by commenting out lines in install scripts? :)
hahaha
but it has to be possilble to comment out obscure coomands such as locateecho. commands that are not even googleable......
Read through the script and see what it is trying to do, then do it yourself manually. A) You'll learn and B) You shouldn't screw anything up
